activities.loc: Branch 1 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelina J Ruesch

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:44am {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Angelina J Ruesch appeared by zoom Iowa County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Angelina J Ruesch.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance. 

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 8:50am  

NEXT:   Status Conference on 12/1/22 at 9:30am via zoom
Arraignment on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 10:30 AM 
Defendant Angelina J Ruesch not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Angelina J Ruesch.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty De La Rosa indicates that Ms. Ruesch was to connect from Iowa Co jail at 9:30am, this did not occur; requests an adjournment. 

recess: 10:32am 
NEXT: Arraignment on 10/11/22 at 8:30am (Def may be at Iowa Co Jail or Dane Co jail)
Arraignment on September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] case called at 9:48am  
Defendant Angelina J Ruesch not in court. Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.  
This case is scheduled for Arraignment today and arrangements had been made for Ms. Ruesch to appear from the Dane County Jail, however it was learned this morning that Ms. Ruesch has very recently transferred to the Iowa County Jail.   
recess 9:49am 

NEXT:  rescheduled Arraignment on September 15th at 9:30am-- arrangements are to be made for Ms. Ruesch to appear by video from the Iowa County Jail
Arraignment on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:46am   {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.}
Defendant Angelina J Ruesch appears via zoom from Dane County Jail, in custody.Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa appears.  Michael C. Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court is able to see and hear Ms. Ruesch. 
Ms. Ruesch is only able to hear proceedings. 

Ms. Ruesch waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

recess: 8:52am  

NEXT:   Arraignment on 8/19/22 at 8:30am (may be by video if technology is remedied-- meaning not both a zoom and phone combination)

records.addlTxt: Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa
JA's Review of 04/18/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (04/25) ML
Status conference on May 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] case called at 8:43am
Defendant Angelina J Ruesch appears by videoconferencing from the Dane County Jail, in custody.  ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ms. Ruesch indicates that she is able to hear the proceedings, however she cannot see the Court or courtroom views.  The Court is able to see and hear Ms. Ruesch.  
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, and the State's deputy-witness is present. 
Right to counsel is reviewed. Ms. Ruesch indicates that she has made many attempts to telephone the Jefferson Public Defenders Office, however she has not been able to get through. She wishes to waive her right to preliminary hearing.  
The Court indicates it will not proceed with a Prelim-Waiver today.  
Attorney De La Rosa who is present in the courtroom voices that he will arrange for someone in his office to contact the Dane County Jail to arrange a Zoom meeting with Ms. Ruesch.  The clerk provides Attorney De La Rosa with the case information.   
Ms. Ruesch requests that the next hearing be scheduled for appearances by Zoom conferencing. 
recess 8:47am 

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of counsel hearing, and possible prelim-waiver) on May 6th at 9:30am with appearances by Zoom conference
No updated address information - unable to forward.  (03/31) ML
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Court Order to Jefferson County Dispatch

[ae] case called 11:07 AM Defendant Angelina J Ruesch appeared by telephone in custody from Dane Co Jail. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $50,000 CASH Bond, with no special conditions

The Court orders booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Office when Defendant is next in Jefferson

recess 11:19 am
NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing on 4/5/22 at 8:30 am [Clerk is to notify SPD defendant is requesting representation]
